title: Wanted 18 T207s to finish the set
author: Sixtofan

posts.post_title: Wanted 18 T207s to finish the set
posts.post_content:
Still need these to finish the set, some tough - some not so tough.  all help appreciated:
Bauman
Carrigan 
Cicotte
Davis (blue C on cap)
Donlin
Donnelly
Fournier
Kelly
Lange
 Irving Lewis (no emblem on sleeve)
Irving Lewis (emblem on sleeve)
Livingston (little C on shirt)
Roy Miller
Ward Miller
Mogridge
Mullin (D on cap)
Rasmussen

Hi David,

   Good luck with your last 18 - that list looks very familiar.  You may have read various threads here regarding the [URL="http://www.network54.com/Forum/153652/thread/1108020415/T207+Davis+blue+C"]Davis "blue C"[/URL] variation.  I'm sorry I missed seeing that image, but those I consider experts deferred on that thread and agreed that it exists.  I think the jury was out on "variation" or print freak, but I struck it from my list - as I think most of the new set listings have done.

Best.
--
Mike

David if you are just interested in completing the set, you can scratch the Davis Blue C and also the Lewis no emblem. Everyone I know considers the set complete with just one Lewis and you are going to find the Lewis emblem on sleeve easier to obtain as the no emblem is a killer. If you want the master set, go for the Lewis no emblem but realize unless you have incredibly good luck AND a wad of dough, that one will probably be unobtainable.
The others you mention are generally the toughest to find. All are obtainable though, provided you have some luck and some money to spend. I would recommend trying to find them even in P-F and then upgrade later and sell your original lower grade card.
Good luck in your endeavor and I will mention to you that every card you list (minus the Lewis no emblem) has been on ebay for sale recently or in an auction so you can find them if you hunt.
tbob
